name: Steampunk Gothic Horror
description: Genre pack for Gothic horror featuring steampunk elements, claustrophobic settings, slow-burn moral corruption, and Victorian atmosphere. Supports locked-room narratives with vampire/monster protagonists and psychological transformation arcs.
author: BQ Studio

required_elements: Atmospheric dread (Victorian setting, mechanical systems, decay)
Beauty in horror (mechanical marvels, intellectual partnership)
gothic_horror_specifics.pacing_philosophy: Slow burn punctuated by horror beats; Gothic favors atmosphere over action (60/40 ratio). Moral corruption must be gradual (8-12 chapters per major boundary crossing). Relationship deepening occurs every 10-15k words.
key_differentiators: NOT paranormal romance (no central romance, ambiguous attraction)
NOT thriller (slow burn, not constant action)
NOT traditional vampire fiction (intellectual focus, cure quest)
IS Gothic horror with steampunk aesthetics

required_metrics: Boundary crossing frequency (1 per 8-12 chapters Book 1, increasing)
Power dynamic shifts (15%+ per book minimum)

market_positioning.target_audience: Adult readers (25-45) seeking dark, complex genre fiction with literary quality prose. Fans of morally gray protagonists, locked-room mysteries, intellectual partnerships, and psychological horror.
comp_titles: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue by V.E. Schwab (immortal protagonist, long quest)
Gideon the Ninth by Tamsyn Muir (locked setting, complex female leads)
The Luminous Dead by Caitlin Starling (claustrophobic tension, morally gray)
Mexican Gothic by Silvia Moreno-Garcia (Gothic horror, isolated setting)
Ninth House by Leigh Bardugo (dark, complex damaged lead)
unique_selling_points: Serial killer vampire protagonist seeking mechanical cure
Victorian steampunk wonderland as both cage and marvel
Intellectual partnership between monster and victim
Slow-burn moral corruption without romance plot
market_positioning.commercial_expectations: Upper midlist with cult favorite potential. Book 1: 5,000-15,000 copies, Series total: 30,000-75,000 copies, Breakout potential: 100,000+ if word-of-mouth ignites. NOT mass market play; career-establishing serious genre fiction.

the_eternal_garden.setting: Hartwell Mechanical Gardens (underground steampunk wonderland, Victorian London 1885)
the_eternal_garden.core_tension: Can a monster who seeks redemption deserve it?

notes: This genre pack supports Gothic horror narratives featuring steampunk elements, particularly locked-setting stories with morally complex protagonists. Emphasizes slow-burn psychological transformation, atmospheric dread, and gradual boundary erosion. NPE physics rules adapted from Urban Fantasy Police Procedural framework but specialized for Gothic pacing and tension types. Suitable for vampire fiction, monster protagonist stories, captive-captor dynamics, redemption quests, and claustrophobic mysteries.
